intention.英释: a plan or desire to do something

negotiate.英释: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

depressed.英释: an area, industry etc that is depressed does not have enough economic or business activity

automatic.英释: an automatic machine is designed to work without needing someone to operate it for each part of a process

voluntary.英释: done willingly and without being forced

tolerance.英释: willingness to allow people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

masculine.英释: having qualities considered to be typical of men or of what men do

transform.英释: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

awareness.英释: knowledge or understanding of a particular subject or situation

subsidize.英释: If a government or other authority subsidizes something, they pay part of the cost of it

ignorance.英释: lack of knowledge or information about something

incidence.英释: the number of times something happens, especially crime, disease etc

recession.英释: a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity etc in a country than usual

irregular.英释: having a shape, surface, pattern etc that is not even, smooth, or balanced

detection.英释: when something is found that is not easy to see, hear etc, or the process of looking for it

determine.英释: if something determines something else, it directly influences or decides it

disappear.英释: to become impossible to see any longer

colleague.英释: someone you work with – used especially by professional people

undertake.英释: to accept that you are responsible for a piece of work, and start to do it

adversity.英释: a situation in which you have a lot of problems that seem to be caused by bad luck

selection.英释: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things

institute.中释: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
institute.英释: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

dormitory.英释: a large building at a college or university where students live

emergency.英释: an unexpected and dangerous situation that must be dealt with immediately

sensitive.英释: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

technical.英释: connected with knowledge of how machines work

imaginary.英释: not real, but produced from pictures or ideas in your mind

associate.英释: to make a connection in your mind between one thing or person and another

establish.英释: to start a company, organization, system, etc that is intended to exist or continue for a long time

collision.英释: a strong disagreement between two people or groups

inflation.英释: a continuing increase in prices, or the rate at which prices increase

interpret.英释: to believe that something someone does or something that happens has a particular meaning

criticize.英释: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

diversity.英释: the fact of including many different types of people or things

logically.中释: 合乎情理地，符合逻辑地

component.英释: one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

quotation.英释: a sentence or phrase from a book, speech etc which you repeat in a speech or piece of writing because it is interesting or amusing

character.英释: a person in a book, play, film etcs

rearrange.英释: to change the position or order of things

caregiver.英释: someone who takes care of a child or sick person

stressful.中释: 充满著压力的，充满著紧张的
stressful.英释: a job, experience, or situation that is stressful makes you worry a lot

eliminate.英释: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

candidate.中释: 申请求职者；投考者；候选人
candidate.英释: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

identical.英释: exactly the same, or very similar

represent.英释: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

seemingly.英释: appearing to have a particular quality, when this may or may not be true

energetic.英释: having or needing a lot of energy or determination

influence.英释: to affect the way someone or something develops, behaves, thinks etc without directly forcing or ordering them

socialize.英释: to spend time with other people in a friendly way

formulate.英释: to develop something such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done

structure.英释: the way in which the parts of something are connected with each other and form a whole, or the thing that these parts make up

architect.英释: someone whose job is to design buildings

admission.中释: 承认；准许进(加)入；入场费
admission.英释: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong

prejudice.英释: to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something

civilized.英释: a civilized society is well organized and developed, and has fair laws and customs

publicize.英释: to give information about something to the public, so that they know about it

favorable.英释: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them

competent.英释: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

emotional.中释: 情绪(上)的，情感(上)的；激起感情的； 敏感的；情绪激动的〔尤指哭泣〕
emotional.英释: relating to your feelings or how you control them

routinely.英释: if something is routinely done, it is done as a normal part of a process or job

criticism.英释: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

synthetic.英释: produced by combining different artificial substances, rather than being naturally produced

encourage.英释: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

homemaker.英释: a woman who works at home cleaning and cooking etc and does not have another job

exception.英释: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

technique.英释: a special way of doing something

complaint.英释: a statement in which someone complains about something

implement.英释: to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

apartment.英释: a set of rooms on one floor of a large building, where someone lives

carpenter.英释: someone whose job is making and repairing wooden objects

principle.英释: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

reception.英释: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc

evolution.英释: the scientific idea that plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

emergence.英释: when something begins to be known or noticed

primitive.中释: 原始的；简单的；简单的，简陋的
primitive.英释: belonging to a simple way of life that existed in the past and does not have modern industries and machines

misguided.英释: a misguided idea or opinion is wrong because it is based on a wrong understanding of a situation

worldwide.英释: If something exists or happens worldwide, it exists or happens throughout the world

consensus.英释: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

objection.英释: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of something, or something you say that expresses this

available.中释: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
available.英释: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

migration.英释: when large numbers of people go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

skyrocket.英释: if a price or an amount skyrockets, it greatly increases very quickly

integrity.英释: the state of being united as one complete thing

catalogue.英释: to make a complete list of all the things in a group

inspector.英释: an official whose job is to check that something is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed

endurance.英释: the ability to continue doing something difficult or painful over a long period of time

treatment.英释: something that is done to cure someone who is injured or ill

realistic.英释: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

reinforce.英释: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

applicant.英释: someone who has formally asked, usually in writing, for a job, university place etc

household.英释: all the people who live together in one house

recommend.英释: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

mechanism.英释: part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job

curiosity.英释: the desire to know about something

committee.英释: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

discharge.中释: 释放；排出；批准离开; 命令离开
discharge.英释: to send out gas, liquid, smoke etc, or to allow it to escape

originate.英释: to come from a particular place or start in a particular situation

incentive.英释: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

cultivate.英释: to work hard to develop a particular skill, attitude, or quality

potential.英释: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future

miserable.英释: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated

corporate.英释: shared by or involving all the members of a group

undermine.中释: 逐渐削弱; 逐渐动摇
undermine.英释: If you undermine someone's efforts or undermine their chances of achieving something, you behave in a way that makes them less likely to succeed

operation.英释: the process of cutting into someone’s body to repair or remove a part that is damaged

laborious.英释: taking a lot of time and effort

fantasize.英释: to imagine that you are doing something which is very pleasant or exciting, but which is very unlikely to happen

universal.中释: 宇宙的，全世界的；普遍的
universal.英释: involving everyone in the world or in a particular group

backslide.英释: to start doing the bad things that you used to do, after having improved your behaviour

reproduce.英释: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

explosion.英释: a loud sound and the energy produced by something such as a bomb bursting into small pieces

guideline.英释: rules or instructions about the best way to do something

promising.英释: showing signs of being successful or good in the future

permanent.英释: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

detective.英释: a police officer whose job is to discover information about crimes and catch criminals

extension.英释: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

emphasize.英释: to say something in a strong way

procedure.英释: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

signature.英释: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

excellent.英释: extremely good or of very high quality

judgement.英释: the ability to make sensible decisions about what to do and when to do it

liability.英释: legal responsibility for something, especially for paying money that is owed, or for damage or injury

resistant.英释: not damaged or affected by something

interview.英释: to ask someone questions during an interview

attribute.英释: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation

highlight.英释: the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

unwilling.英释: not wanting to do something and refusing to do it

financial.英释: relating to money or the management of money

symbolize.英释: if something symbolizes a quality, feeling etc, it represents it

addiction.英释: the need to take a harmful drug regularly, without being able to stop

underline.英释: to show that something is important

tasteless.英释: food or drink that is tasteless is unpleasant because it has no particular taste

excessive.英释: much more than is reasonable or necessary

dishonest.英释: not honest, and so deceiving or cheating people

pointless.英释: worthless or not likely to have any useful result

ambitious.英释: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

calculate.英释: to find out how much something will cost, how long something will take etc, by using numbers

selective.英释: careful about what you choose to do, buy, allow etc

guarantee.英释: a formal promise that something will be done

stimulate.英释: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

regularly.英释: at the same time each day, week, month etc

fascinate.英释: if someone or something fascinates you, you are attracted to them and think they are extremely interesting

situation.英释: a combination of all the things that are happening and all the conditions that exist at a particular time in a particular place

embarrass.英释: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people

challenge.英释: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

overstate.英释: to talk about something in a way that makes it seem more important, serious etc than it really is

territory.英释: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

explosive.英释: a substance that can cause an explosion

pollution.英释: the process of making air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use, or the state of being dangerously dirty

editorial.英释: a piece of writing in a newspaper that gives the editor’s opinion about something, rather than reporting facts

plentiful.中释: 丰富的， 充足的； 大量的

frustrate.中释: 使沮丧， 使灰心； 挫败， 使受挫折
frustrate.英释: if something frustrates you, it makes you feel annoyed or angry because you are unable to do what you want

authority.中释: 官方； 权力； 当权者， 行政管理机构； 权威， 专家
authority.英释: the power you have because of your official position

personnel.英释: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

invisible.英释: something that is invisible cannot be seen

framework.中释: 框架， 结构； 准则； 体系
framework.英释: a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

aeroplane.英释: a flying vehicle with wings and at least one engine

adventure.中释: 奇遇； 冒险， 冒险活动
adventure.英释: an exciting experience in which dangerous or unusual things happen

condition.中释: 状况， 状态； 环境
condition.英释: the state that something is in, especially how good or bad its physical state is

effective.英释: successful, and working in the way that was intended

fantastic.中释: 极好的， 极出色的， 了不起的； 极大的； 难以相信的； 异想天开的， 不实际的； 奇异的， 古怪的

circulate.中释: 循环， 流通； 流传， 散布， 传播
circulate.英释: to move around within a system, or to make something do this

recognize.中释: 认出， 识别； 承认； 赏识， 表彰， 报偿
recognize.英释: to know who someone is or what something is, because you have seen, heard, experienced, or learned about them in the past

restraint.中释: 抑制， 限制， 克制； 约束措施， 约束条件
restraint.英释: calm sensible controlled behaviour, especially in a situation when it is difficult to stay calm

librarian.英释: someone who works in a library

insurance.英释: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged

deception.中释: 欺骗； 诡计， 骗局
deception.英释: the act of deliberately making someone believe something that is not true

basically.中释: 基本上， 从根本上说
basically.英释: used to emphasize the most important reason or fact about something, or a simple explanation of something

solicitor.英释: a type of lawyer in Britain who gives legal advice, prepares the necessary documents when property is bought or sold, and defends people, especially in the lower courts of law

suspicion.中释: 怀疑， 疑心， 猜疑； 一点儿， 少量
suspicion.英释: a feeling you have that someone is probably guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

ambulance.英释: a special vehicle that is used to take people who are ill or injured to hospital

formation.中释: 形成， 构成， 形成物； 队形， 排列
formation.英释: the process of starting a new organization or group

efficient.中释: 效率高的； 有能力的
efficient.英释: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy

summarize.中释: 概括， 概述， 总结
summarize.英释: to make a short statement giving only the main information and not the details of a plan, event, report etc

commander.英释: an officer of any rank who is in charge of a group of soldiers or a particular military activity

interrupt.中释: 打断， 打扰， 中断
interrupt.英释: to stop someone from continuing what they are saying or doing by suddenly speaking to them, making a noise etc

prescribe.中释: 开； 吩咐采用； 规定， 指定
prescribe.英释: to state officially what should be done in a particular situation

sacrifice.中释: 牺牲； 供奉； 祭品
sacrifice.英释: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important

entertain.中释: 使欢乐； 招待， 请客
entertain.英释: to invite people to your home for a meal, party etc, or to take your company’s customers somewhere to have a meal, drinks etc

elsewhere.英释: in, at, or to another place

penetrate.中释: 透入， 渗入， 进入； 刺穿； 洞察， 了解
penetrate.英释: to enter something and pass or spread through it, especially when this is difficult

principal.中释: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角
principal.英释: someone who is in charge of a school

dimension.中释: 尺寸， 尺度； 方面， 特点； 面积， 规模
dimension.英释: a part of a situation or a quality involved in it

encounter.英释: an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

gratitude.中释: 感激， 感谢， 感恩

interfere.中释: 干涉， 干预， 妨碍
interfere.英释: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

whichever.中释: 无论哪个， 无论哪些

pluralism.中释: 多重性； 兼职， 兼任

regarding.英释: a word used especially in letters or speeches to introduce the subject you are writing or talking about

confusion.中释: 困惑， 糊涂； 混淆； 骚乱
confusion.英释: when you do not understand what is happening or what something means because it is not clear

injection.中释: 注射， 注入； 充满
injection.英释: an act of putting a drug into someone’s body using a special needle

construct.中释: 建筑物； 构想， 观念
construct.英释: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

executive.英释: a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

physicist.英释: a scientist who has special knowledge and training in  physics

machinery.英释: You can use machinery to refer to machines in general, or machines that are used in a factory or on a farm

inference.中释: 推断结果， 结论； 推论， 推理， 推断
inference.英释: something that you think is true, based on information that you have

cigarette.中释: 香烟， 纸烟， 卷烟
cigarette.英释: a thin tube of paper filled with finely cut tobacco that people smoke

favourite.英释: something that you like more than other things of the same kind

aluminium.英释: a silver-white metal that is very light and is used to make cans, cooking pans, window frames etc. It is a chemical  element  : symbol Al

residence.中释: 住处， 住宅； 居住； 居住资格
residence.英释: the state of living in a place

intensive.中释: 加强的； 精深的， 透彻的； 精耕细作的
intensive.英释: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time

spokesman.英释: a man who has been chosen to speak officially for a group, organization, or government

intensity.中释: 强烈， 剧烈； 强度
intensity.英释: the quality of being felt very strongly or having a strong effect

invention.中释: 发明， 创造； 捏造
invention.英释: a useful machine, tool, instrument etc that has been invented

religious.中释: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
religious.英释: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

butterfly.英释: a type of insect that has large wings, often with beautiful colours

dictation.英释: when you say words for someone to write down

childhood.中释: 童年， 幼年， 早期
childhood.英释: A person's childhood is the period of their life when they are a child

democracy.中释: 民主， 民主制； 民主国家
democracy.英释: a system of government in which every citizen in the country can vote to elect its government officials

extensive.英释: large in size, amount, or degree

afterward.英释: If you do something or if something happens afterward, you do it or it happens after a particular event or time that has already been mentioned

impatient.英释: annoyed because of delays, someone else’s mistakes etc

appliance.中释: 用具， 器具， 器械； 家电
appliance.英释: a piece of equipment, especially electrical equipment, such as a  cooker  or  washing machine  , used in people’s homes

desirable.中释: 值得向往的， 令人满意的

dependent.中释: 依靠的， 依赖的； 取决于…的
dependent.英释: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

classical.英释: belonging to a traditional style or set of ideas

privilege.英释: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

naturally.中释: 当然； 天然地； 天生地
naturally.英释: use this to say that something is normal and not surprising

excursion.英释: a short journey arranged so that a group of people can visit a place, especially while they are on holiday

alongside.中释: 在…旁边， 沿着…的边； 和…在一起

anonymous.中释: 匿名的； 无名的； 无特色的

fisherman.英释: someone who catches fish as a sport or as a job

existence.中释: 存在， 实在， 生存

reference.中释: 提到， 论及； 参考； 引文； 参考书目； 证明书， 证明人
reference.英释: part of something you say or write in which you mention a person or thing

publicity.中释: 公众的注意， 名声； 宣传， 宣扬
publicity.英释: Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something

provision.中释: 供应； 准备； 条款， 规定； 给养， 口粮
provision.英释: when you provide something that someone needs now or in the future

according.中释: 相等的， 一致的， 依…而定的

advantage.中释: 优点， 优势， 好处
advantage.英释: a good or useful feature that something has

assistant.英释: someone who helps someone else in their work, especially by doing the less important jobs

newsstand.英释: A newsstand is a stall in the street or a public place, which sells newspapers and magazines

worthless.英释: something that is worthless has no value, importance, or use

landscape.英释: to make a park, garden etc look attractive and interesting by changing its design, and by planting trees and bushes etc

temporary.英释: continuing for only a limited period of time

desperate.中释: 拼死的， 不顾一切的； 绝望的； 极需要的
desperate.英释: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

community.中释: 社区， 社会， 公社； 团体， 界； 群落
community.英释: the people who live in the same area, town etc

courtyard.英释: an open space that is completely or partly surrounded by buildings

surrender.中释: 交出， 放弃； 投降
surrender.英释: to say officially that you want to stop fighting, because you realize that you cannot win

therefore.英释: as a result of something that has just been mentioned

companion.中释: 同伴， 共事者； 伴侣
companion.英释: someone you spend a lot of time with, especially a friend

breakdown.中释: 垮， 衰竭； 损坏， 故障； 倒塌
breakdown.英释: an occasion when a car or a piece of machinery breaks and stops working

overnight.中释: 一整夜的； 一夜间的， 突然的
overnight.英释: happening during the night or for the night

satellite.英释: a machine that has been sent into space and goes around the Earth, moon etc, used for radio, television, and other electronic communication

reservoir.中释: 水库， 蓄水池； 储藏， 汇集
reservoir.英释: a lake, especially an artificial one, where water is stored before it is supplied to people’s houses

copyright.英释: the legal right to be the only producer or seller of a book, play, film, or record for a specific length of time

variation.中释: 变化， 变动； 变异； 变奏
variation.英释: a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of something

viewpoint.中释: 观点， 看法， 见解
viewpoint.英释: a particular way of thinking about a problem or subject

confident.中释: 确信的， 肯定的； 自信的
confident.英释: sure that something will happen in the way that you want or expect

withstand.英释: to defend yourself successfully against people who attack, criticize, or oppose you

preceding.中释: 在前的， 在先的， 前面的
preceding.英释: happening or coming before the time, place, or part mentioned

precision.英释: the quality of being very exact or correct

transport.英释: a system or method for carrying passengers or goods from one place to another

exclusive.英释: an important or exciting story that is printed in only one newspaper, because that newspaper was the first to find out about it

lightning.英释: a powerful flash of light in the sky caused by electricity and usually followed by thunder

telescope.英释: a piece of equipment shaped like a tube, used for making distant objects look larger and closer

presently.中释: 不久， 一会儿； 现在， 目前

furniture.英释: large objects such as chairs, tables, beds, and cupboards

statistic.中释: 统计数值， 统计资料； 统计学
statistic.英释: a single number which represents a fact or measurement

delicious.中释: 美味的； 芬芳的， 怡人的； 有趣的
delicious.英释: very pleasant to taste or smell

volunteer.英释: someone who does a job willingly without being paid

statement.中释: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
statement.英释: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

substance.中释: 物质； 实质； 大意， 要旨； 根据， 理由
substance.英释: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

container.英释: something such as a box or bowl that you use to keep things in

conductor.中释: 售票员， 列车长； 指挥； 导体
conductor.英释: someone who stands in front of a group of musicians or singers and directs their playing or singing

affection.英释: If you regard someone or something with affection, you like them and are fond of them

erroneous.英释: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

reduction.中释: 减少， 缩小； 下降， 降低
reduction.英释: a decrease in the size, price, or amount of something, or the act of decreasing something

integrate.英释: to become part of a group or society and be accepted by them, or to help someone do this（

necessity.中释: 必需品； 必要性， 需要
necessity.英释: something that you need to have in order to live

brilliant.英释: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong

elaborate.英释: If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

youngster.中释: 青年， 年轻人， 孩子

paragraph.英释: part of a piece of writing which starts on a new line and contains at least one sentence

immigrant.英释: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

tradition.英释: a belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time, or these beliefs, customs etc in general

generally.中释: 一般地， 通常地； 普遍地

conscious.中释: 意识到的， 自觉的； 神志清醒的； 有意的， 存心的

orchestra.英释: a large group of musicians playing many different kinds of instruments and led by a conductor

petroleum.英释: oil that is obtained from below the surface of the Earth and is used to make petrol,  paraffin  , and various chemical substances

expansion.中释: 扩大， 扩充， 扩张， 膨胀
expansion.英释: when something increases in size, range, amount etc

auxiliary.中释: 辅助的， 附属的； 后备的
auxiliary.英释: auxiliary workers provide additional help for another group of workers

radiation.中释: 放射物， 辐射能； 辐射
radiation.英释: a form of energy that comes especially from nuclear reactions, which in large amounts is very harmful to living things

Christian.英释: a person who believes in the ideas taught by Jesus Christ

spiritual.中释: 精神的， 心灵的； 宗教的
spiritual.英释: relating to your spirit rather than to your body or mind

strategic.中释: 对全局有重要意义的， 关键的； 战略的
strategic.英释: done as part of a plan, especially in a military, business, or political situation

evidently.英释: used to say that something is true because you can see that it is true

objective.英释: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

victimize.英释: to treat someone unfairly because you do not like them, their beliefs, or the race they belong to

allowance.中释: 津贴， 补贴； 零用钱
allowance.英释: an amount of money that you are given regularly or for a special purpose

secondary.中释: 次要的， 第二的； 中等的； 辅助的， 从属的
secondary.英释: not as important as something else

mainframe.英释: a large powerful computer that can work very fast and that a lot of people can use at the same time

advisable.英释: something that is advisable should be done in order to avoid problems or risks

cooperate.中释: 合作， 协作； 配合
cooperate.英释: to work with someone else to achieve something that you both want

offensive.英释: a planned military attack involving large forces over a long period

speculate.中释: 推测， 推断； 投机， 做投机买卖
speculate.英释: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

intervene.中释: 干涉， 调停， 干预； 插入， 介入； 干扰， 打扰
intervene.英释: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

frequency.中释: 屡次； 次数， 频率
frequency.英释: the fact that something happens a lot

socialist.英释: someone who believes in socialism, or who is a member of a political party that supports socialism

socialism.英释: an economic and political system in which large industries are owned by the government, and taxes are used to take some wealth away from richer citizens and give it to poorer citizens

advertise.中释: 为…做广告， 宣传； 公告； 登广告
advertise.英释: to tell the public about a product or service in order to persuade them to buy it

following.英释: a group of people who support or admire someone

apologize.中释: 道歉， 谢罪， 认错
apologize.英释: to tell someone that you are sorry that you have done something wrong

nightmare.中释: 噩梦； 可怕的事物， 无法摆脱的恐惧

departure.中释: 离开， 起程， 出发； 背离， 违背
departure.英释: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

sociology.英释: the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups

continual.英释: continuing for a long time without stopping

arbitrary.中释: 随心所欲的， 专断的
arbitrary.英释: decided or arranged without any reason or plan, often unfairly

president.中释: 总统；（某组织的）最高权力人
president.英释: the official leader of a country that does not have a king or queen

hamburger.英释: a flat round piece of finely cut beef which is cooked and eaten in a bread bun

messenger.英释: someone whose job is to deliver messages or documents, or someone who takes a message to someone else

classmate.英释: a member of the same class in a school, college or – in the US – a university

education.英释: the process of teaching and learning, usually at school, college, or university

breakfast.英释: the meal you have in the morning

beginning.英释: the start or first part of an event, story, period of time etc

professor.英释: a teacher of the highest rank in a university department

gentleman.英释: a man who is always polite, has good manners, and treats other people well

knowledge.英释: the information, skills, and understanding that you have gained through learning or experience

beautiful.英释: someone or something that is beautiful is extremely attractive to look at

dishonour.英释: loss of respect from other people, because you have behaved in a morally unacceptable way

apparatus.英释: the set of tools and machines that you use for a particular scientific, medical, or technical purpose

adjective.英释: a word that describes a noun or  pronoun. In the phrase ‘black hat’, ‘black’ is an adjective and in the sentence ‘It makes her happy’, ‘happy’ is an adjective.

secretary.英释: someone who works in an office typing letters, keeping records, answering telephone calls, arranging meetings etc

Australia.英释: An island country and continent in the southern hemisphere, in the south-western Pacific Ocean, a member state of the Commonwealth of Nations; population 28,500,000 (estimated 2015); capital, Canberra; official language, English.

immediate.英释: happening or done at once and without delay

ourselves.英释: used by the person speaking to show that they and one or more other people are affected by their own action

attention.英释: when you carefully listen to, look at, or think about someone or something

submarine.英释: a ship, especially a military one, that can stay under water

chemistry.英释: the science that is concerned with studying the structure of substances and the way that they change or combine with each other

equipment.英释: the tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity

chocolate.英释: a sweet brown food that you can eat as a sweet or use in cooking to give foods such as cakes a special sweet taste

kilometre.英释: a unit for measuring distance, equal to 1,000 metres

gradually.英释: slowly, over a long period of time

obviously.英释: used to mean that a fact can easily be noticed or understood

pronounce.英释: to make the sound of a letter, word etc, especially in the correct way

direction.英释: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed

communist.英释: someone who is a member of a political party that supports communism, or who believes in communism

practical.英释: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

displease.英释: to make sb feel upset, annoyed or not satisfied

accessary.英释: someone who helps a criminal, especially by helping them hide from the police

announcer.英释: someone who reads news or information on the television or radio

Christmas.英释: the period of time around December 25th, the day when Christians celebrate the birth of Christ

evaporate.英释: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

otherwise.英释: used to state what the result would be if sth did not happen or if the situation were different

geography.英释: the study of the countries, oceans, rivers, mountains, cities etc of the world

astronaut.英释: someone who travels and works in a spacecraft

gunpowder.英释: an explosive substance used in bombs and  fireworks

important.英释: an important event, decision, problem etc has a big effect or influence on people’s lives or on events in the future

afternoon.英释: the part of the day after the morning and before the evening

dangerous.英释: able or likely to harm or kill you

northeast.英释: The northeast edge, corner, or part of a place is the part which is toward the northeast

honeymoon.英释: a holiday taken by two people who have just got married

agreement.英释: an arrangement or promise to do something, made by two or more people, companies, organizations etc

badminton.英释: a game that is similar to tennis but played with a shuttlecock instead of a ball

classroom.英释: a room that you have lessons in at a school or college

neighbour.英释: someone who lives next to you or near you

stability.英释: the condition of being steady and not changing

difficult.英释: hard to do, understand, or deal with

political.英释: connected with the state, government or public affairs

northwest.英释: in the northwest of a place

continent.英释: a large mass of land surrounded by sea

mechanics.英释: the science of movement and force

reflexion.英释: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

doubtless.英释: used when saying that something is almost certain to happen or be true

housewife.英释: a married woman who works at home doing the cooking, cleaning etc, but does not have a job outside the house

cafeteria.英释: a restaurant, often in a factory, college etc, where you choose from foods that have already been cooked and carry your own food to a table

necessary.英释: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do

passenger.英释: someone who is travelling in a vehicle, plane, boat etc, but is not driving it or working on it

attentive.英释: listening to or watching someone carefully because you are interested

introduce.英释: if you introduce someone to another person, you tell them each other’s names for the first time

celebrate.英释: to show that an event or occasion is important by doing something special or enjoyable

cathedral.英释: the main church of a particular area under the control of a  bishop

foreigner.英释: someone who comes from a different country

newspaper.英释: a set of large folded sheets of printed paper containing news, articles, pictures, advertisements etc which is sold daily or weekly

fortunate.英释: someone who is fortunate has something good happen to them, or is in a good situation

indignant.英释: angry and surprised because you feel insulted or unfairly treated

sportsman.英释: a man who plays several different sports

broadcast.英释: a programme on the radio or on television

communism.英释: a political system in which the government controls the production of all food and goods, and there is no privately owned property
